data.title: Events — Legal Aid of Southeastern Pennsylvania
data.text:
Expungement Clinic in Norristown

NORRISTOWN - Join Rep. Greg Scott and Legal Aid of Southeastern PA for an Expungement Clinic on Wednesday, July 24, 2024 from 12-2 p.m. The free clinic will take place at Rep. Scott’s office at 1019 W. Main St., Norristown, PA 19401.

Rep. Scott said, “We’re here to assist you with all your state-related needs. Don’t miss this opportunity - I look forward to seeing you there and helping our community move forward.”

RSVP at https://bit.ly/rsvp-7-24-2024.

View Event →

Legal Outreach in Lansdale

LANSDALE - Legal Aid of Southeastern PA (LASP) will hold a free monthly outreach at Manna on Main Street / North Penn Commons, 606 E. Main St., Lansdale, PA 19446. Stop by our table from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. on Thursday, July 25, Aug. 22, Sept. 26, Oct. 24, Nov. 21 and Dec. 19, 2024.

Have a question about the outreach? Contact Erika Felpel at 484-275-0672 or efelpel@lasp.org.

Se habla español. Language access & interpretation available for 240+ other languages.

Flyer (download, print, share!)

Some of the case types LASP handles: Bankruptcy, consumer law & debt relief, child custody & dependency, domestic violence / Protection from Abuse orders (PFAs), elder law, expungement, record-sealing and pardons, family law, housing (landlord-tenant, eviction, habitability, public & subsidized housing, rent-to-own), and home ownership (mortgage foreclosure, property tax sales, reverse mortgages, tangled title), Hurricane Ida / disaster legal aid, public benefits [Unemployment Compensation, SSI, SSDI, TANF (cash assistance), SNAP (food stamps), Medical Assistance (Medicaid) & more], utility problems, Veterans benefits & discharge upgrades.

View Event →

Legally Blonde: A Musical ~ Pay What You Want Preview

POTTSTOWN - On Thursday, July 25, 2024, Steel River Playhouse will host its first ever Pay-What-You-Want Preview of Legally Blonde! Join us at 245 E High St, Pottstown, PA 19464.

This preview at 7 p.m. is part of Steel River Playhouse's Accessible Ticket programming and will honor LASP. Before showtime, LASP staff will provide brief remarks about our impact and services in Montgomery, Bucks, Chester and Delaware counties. LASP has a longtime local office in Pottstown, as well as in Bristol, Chester, Doylestown, Media, Norristown and West Chester.

Pay-What-You-Want performances ask audiences to set their own ticket price (even $0), with option to donate towards Steel River's mission at the end of show. It is part of Steel River's efforts to make theater more accessible to any and all members of our community.

Can’t make it for the preview? The show runs through Sunday, Aug. 4! Tickets: https://bit.ly/legally-blonde-2024

LASP News: lasp.org/news/legally-blonde-pottstown-2024

View Event →

Virtual: What's Next for Our Communities? Grants Pass Decision Briefing and Opportunities for Local Advocacy

The Bucks-Mont Collaborative presents “What's Next for Our Communities? Grants Pass Decision Briefing and Opportunities for Local Advocacy” on Thursday, Aug. 1, 2024 from 12-1:15 p.m.

Register for this free, virtual meeting at https://bit.ly/BucksMont-8-1-2024.

Join local leaders for a discussion on the June 28, 2024 U.S. Supreme Court decision on Grants Pass v. Johnson, and opportunities for local awareness raising and advocacy in response.

Flyer (1-page PDF): read, print, share!

View Event →

Family Fest in Souderton

SOUDERTON - Looking for a day of FREE family fun this summer? Join Sen. Maria Collett and Rep. Steve Malagari on Saturday, Aug. 3, 2024 from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. for their Family Fest at Souderton Community Park , 459 Wile Ave., Souderton, PA 18964.

Stop by LASP’s table at this event! The Community Engagement Unit will be on hand to answer questions about record-clearing, name changes, and other civil legal needs.

The event will feature:

Vendor tables with local resources & giveaways

Music

Refreshments

Balloon animals

Yard games

Family-friendly tunes

and more!

Questions? Please contact Rep. Malagari's office at 267-768-3671.

No RSVP needed. Simply show up and enjoy the festivities!

Eventbrite listing

View Event →

Community Health Fair in Pottstown

POTTSTOWN - Community Health & Dental Care presents a Community Health Fair to celebrate National Health Center Week Aug. 4-10. The health fair is Friday, Aug. 9 from 11 a.m.-2 p.m at Coventry Mall / Community Health & Dental Care, 351 W. Schuylkill Road, Pottstown, PA 19465.

People of all ages are invited to a fun-filled day with health information, diverse community resources, giveaways, activities for kids and adults, refreshments, FREE health screenings for blood pressure, and more! Stop by LASP's table at this event.

FREE BACKPACK GIVEAWAY! 100 backpacks filled with back-to-school supplies will be offered to any student under age 18 who needs a backpack to start the school year. Be sure to stop by early if you need a backpack.

CHDC event page: ch-dc.org/nhcw2024

View Event →

Legal Clinic in Exton

EXTON - A free legal clinic will be held monthly at PA CareerLink of Chester County. The clinics are the second Wednesday from July-December 2024: Wednesday, Aug. 14, Sept. 11, Oct. 9, Nov. 13 & Dec. 11, 2024.

Each clinic will be from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. at PA CareerLink, 479 Thomas Jones Way, Suite 500, Exton, PA 19380.

To schedule a 30-minute appointment with a LASP attorney, contact United Way of Chester County at 610-429-9400.

The clinics are a partnership between LASP, United Way of Chester County's Financial Stability Center, and PA CareerLink of Chester County.

LASP serves Chester, Bucks, Delaware and Montgomery counties.

Flyer (1-page PDF): download, print, share!

View Event →

CLE for attorneys ~ Lawyering Together: Lawyers and Students Working Together for the Community

NORRISTOWN - The Montgomery Bar Association Pro Bono Committee will present the CLE, “Lawyering Together: Lawyers and Students Working Together for the Community” on Wednesday, Aug. 21, 2024 from 12-1:30 p.m. The CLE will be at the Montgomery Bar Association, 100 W. Mt. Airy St., Norristown, PA 19401.

Lawyering Together is a program through Villanova University to bring together private attorneys and law students. In summer 2024, an attorney will work with one to two Villanova Law students to complete a pro bono case assignment for Legal Aid of Southeastern PA. This CLE will outline how the program worked for a group of attorneys and students so that you can do it too! We will review the ethics involved in working with students to complete legal work.

Register: https://bit.ly/MBA-8-21-2024

Lunch & Registration from 12-12:30 p.m.

Speakers:

Timothy M. Knowles, Attorney, Warren McGraw & Knowles, & MBA Pro Bono Committee co-chair

Anita M. Seth, Managing Partner, AMS Law, P.C.

Moderator: Melina Dixon, Legal Aid of Southeastern PA Staff Attorney

Credit

Credit has been approved with the Supreme Court of Pennsylvania Continuing Legal Education Board for 1 Legal Ethics credit.

View Event →

Legal Outreach in Lansdale

LANSDALE - Legal Aid of Southeastern PA (LASP) will hold a free monthly outreach at Manna on Main Street / North Penn Commons, 606 E. Main St., Lansdale, PA 19446. Stop by our table from 11 a.m.-1 p.m. on Thursday, Aug. 22, Sept. 26, Oct. 24, Nov. 21 and Dec. 19, 2024.

Have a question about the outreach? Contact Erika Felpel at 484-275-0672 or efelpel@lasp.org.

Senior Fair in Lansdale

LANSDALE - Calling all seniors! Join Rep. Steve Malagari on Thursday, Aug. 29, 2024 for his fifth annual senior fair! It will be from 10 a.m.-1 p.m. at Trinity Lutheran Church, 100 W. Main St., Lansdale, PA 19446.

This FREE event includes health screenings, vaccinations, information for seniors and caregivers, plus light refreshments. You don't want to miss it!

Stop by Legal Aid of Southeastern PA's table at this event to learn about legal needs related to elder law and and many more civil legal aid issues.

Flyer (1-page)

View Event →

Senior Fair in Plymouth Meeting

PLYMOUTH MEETING - Join Rep. Greg Scott for his Senior Fair on Tuesday, Sept. 10, 2024 from 11 a.m.-2 p.m. at Greater Plymouth Community Center, 2910 Jolly Road, Plymouth Meeting, PA 19462.

Stop by LASP’s table at this event to get information on free civil legal aid in a wide range of issues, including elder law, housing (landlord-tenant, eviction and mortgage foreclosure), family law, domestic violence, consumer, debt, public benefits, record-clearing, veterans and more.

Child Custody Workshop in Exton

EXTON - Join GRANDFamily Connections of Chester County and Legal Aid of Southeastern PA for a free Child Custody Workshop on Tuesday, July 23, 2024 from 6:30-8 p.m. at United Way of Chester County (Community Room), 150 John Robert Thomas Drive, Exton, PA 19341.

Learn from a Legal Aid of Southeastern PA attorney about:

Legal options including child custody, guardianship, & dependency.

How cases move through the court.

What to do if you believe one of these options is right for your family.

Register in advance! Use this Google Form: bit.ly/grandfamily-7-23-2024

Questions: Contact Deborah Willett, Program Coordinator for GRANDFamily Connections of Chester County, at DWillettAdvocacy@gmail.com or 610-246-2261

GRANDFamily Connections of Chester County invites grandparents & caregivers taking care of minor children to a free legal workshop.

Event flyer (1-page PDF): read, print, download, share!

View Event →

Veterans BBQ at Wilson Farm Park

CHESTERBROOK - Veterans, friends, and family are all welcome to Rep. Melissa Shusterman’s annual Veterans BBQ at the Wilson Farm Park Pavilion on Saturday, July 13, 2024 from 11:30 a.m.-1:30 p.m. A hearty buffet from Mission BBQ will be served. Several veterans' organizations, including LASP’S Veterans Advocacy Project, will be on hand to answer questions about benefits and services.

Wilson Farm Park is at 500 Lee Road, Chesterbrook, PA 19087. (Location may show up on phone navigation systems as Wayne).

Open to residents of Willistown Township, Easttown Township, Tredyffrin Township, and Schuylkill Township, Chester County.

Please RSVP by Tuesday, July 9 to reserve your meals: https://bit.ly/ShustermanBBQ2024

Prefer to RSVP by phone? Call us Monday-Friday, 9 a.m.-4:30 p.m. at 484-200-8260.

View Event →

Veterans Resource and Health Fair

SPRING CITY - A Veteran Resource & Health Fair will be Saturday, July 13, 2024 at American Legion Post 602 at 25 N. Main St., Spring City, PA 1947.

The following organizations will provide information on their services:

Chester County Food Bank

Community Health and Dental Care

Legal Aid of Southeastern PA (LASP)

Penn Pharmacy

PMSI Comprehensive Health Care

Southeastern Veteran Center

Royersford Dental Health

Free vaccines and health screenings will be available.

Stop by LASP’s table to learn about the Veterans Advocacy Project and its work on VA benefits, discharge upgrades, and a wide array of civil legal issues such as housing (landlord-tenant, eviction, mortgage foreclosure), family law, domestic violence, public benefits, consumer, record-cleaning, expungements, Clean Slate 3.0, and more.

Flyer (1-page PDF)

View Event →

Mobile Home Tax Reassessment Clinic in West Grove

WEST GROVE - Join Legal Aid of Southeastern PA and United Way of Chester County for a Mobile Home Tax Reassessment outreach event! Get your mobile home taxes reassessed for free on Friday, July 12, 2024 from 5-7 p.m. at Oxford Village, 2 Dolinger Drive, West Grove, PA 19390.

What to bring:

Know the year, make, model and size of your mobile home

A property tax bill, preferably the school tax bill

Title or sales agreement to your mobile home (information about how much you paid for the home, including a bill of sale if you purchased within the past 5 years)

Insurance information

Assessment help is available in English and Spanish.

Since 2019, this impactful project has helped 1,014 mobile home owners save $800 annually!

Contacts:

For more information, visit https://bit.ly/unitedwaycc-mobile-homes or call 877-429-5994.

Para más información en español, llame a 610-436-4510.

Webpages:

https://bit.ly/unitedwaycc-mobile-homes

https://bit.ly/lasp-chesco-mobile-homes

View Event →

Legal Aid Clinic at Norristown Hospitality Center

NORRISTOWN - Join the Norristown Hospitality Center and Legal Aid of Southeastern PA (LASP) for a free legal clinic. The clinic is Thursday, July 11, 2024 from 9-10:30 a.m. at the Norristown Hospitality Center, 530 Church St., Norristown, PA 19401.

If you are interested in getting help from the clinic, please call 610-277-1322 and ask for Clara. Clara will add your name to the Legal Clinic list. No appointment is necessary.

We look forward to seeing you!

Some of the legal issues that LASP may be able to help with include:

Social security benefits (denials, overpayments, initial application, etc.)

Public benefits (SNAP, Medicaid, denials, overpayments)

Expungements, record-sealing, Clean Slate, pardons

Housing (eviction habitability, public or subsidized housing, rent-to-own, mortgage foreclosure)

Unemployment Compensation

Bankruptcy, consumer law debt relief

Family law (child custody, divorce)

Domestic violence, including Protection from Abuse (PFA) orders and legal problems related to domestic violence

Veterans benefits and discharge upgrades

Hurricane Ida issues

Each clinic will be from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. at PA CareerLink, 479 Thomas Jones Way, Suite 500, Exton, PA 19380.

To schedule a 30-minute appointment with a LASP attorney, contact United Way of Chester County at 610-429-9400.

The clinics are a partnership between LASP, United Way of Chester County's Financial Stability Center, and PA CareerLink of Chester County.

LASP serves Chester, Bucks, Delaware and Montgomery counties.

Legal Aid Golf Classic

LAFAYETTE HILL - The Montgomery Bar Foundation presents the 2024 Legal Aid Golf Classic!

Join us on Monday, June 24, 2024 from 11:30 a.m.-6:30 p.m. at the Green Valley Country Club, 201 W. Ridge Pike, Lafayette Hill, PA 19444.

Registration is now open for the 2024 Legal Aid Golf Classic!

This year's premier summer golf event and community social will return to Green Valley Country Club in Lafayette Hill, with lunch and registration beginning at 11:30 a.m., and a shotgun start at 1 p.m. A great day of golf and on-course attractions will be followed by a special cocktail reception at 5:15 p.m., featuring golf awards, raffle prizes, and the presentation of the Montgomery Bar Foundation's prestigious community service awards.

There are several ways to support Legal Aid of Southeastern Pennsylvania (LASP) at this event: golf, attend the cocktail awards reception, purchase and/or sell raffle tickets, or become an event sponsor. As always, proceeds will be matched dollar-for-dollar by the Montgomery Bar Association and will benefit LASP’s impactful work!

For questions about golf or problems with registration,

please contact Megan Ware at megan@montgomerybar.org or 610-994-3666.

For any questions about sponsorship,

please contact Jim Mathias at 610-994-3660 or 610-213-2669.

Learn more and sponsor at the Montgomery Bar Association event page: https://bit.ly/golf-6-24-2024.

Legal Aid of Southeastern PA greatly appreciates the support of the Montgomery Bar Foundation and Montgomery Bar Association in organizing this event, and to all event sponsors, golfers and supporters!

View Event →

Legal Needs Survey for advocates & community members

Attorneys, paralegals, legal professionals, service providers and community members, please share YOUR voice! Legal Aid of Southeastern PA urgently needs to hear from YOU.

What are the civil legal needs in Bucks, Chester, Delaware and/or Montgomery counties?

This needs assessment survey will help inform our strategic planning process. The survey takes 7-8 minutes. You can choose to remain anonymous or provide contact information for follow-up.. LASP greatly appreciates your input!

Community members, including people who have sought help from LASP or thought about doing so, as well as other community members: (English or Spanish)

English survey: https://bit.ly/LASPLegalNeeds2024

Spanish survey: https://bit.ly/LegalNeedsSpanish24

Advocates (attorneys, paralegals, legal professionals, social workers, service organization staff, teachers, etc.):

https://bit.ly/LASPLegalNeedsAdvocates

View Event →

Get your mobile home taxes reassessed for free onTuesday, June 18, 2024 from 5-7 p.m. at Kennett Area YMCA, 101 Race St., Kennett Square, PA 19348. (Photo ID required.)

Know the year, make, model and size of your mobile home

Virtual Clean Slate and Expungement Workshop

Join us on Tuesday, June 18, 2024 from 3:30-4:30 p.m. for a VIRTUAL Clean Slate & Expungement Workshop. The Coatesville Center for Community Health is hosting Legal Aid of Southeastern PA. Clean Slate 3.0 is in effect! The new law expands eligibility & shortens some wait times for record-sealing! It also automatically seals some records.

The workshop will help individuals with criminal histories who may have been denied employment or other services because of their criminal record.

Learn if you are eligible to have your criminal record sealed or expunged

Legal Aid of Southeastern Pennsylvania attorneys will help screen your PA record for FREE.

Help will be available to complete the necessary forms for those that are eligible.

Register in advance to attend

Register: https://bit.ly/3U7tJIt

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

Bring with you

Intake Form to be completed in advance can be accessed here: https://pdf.ac/GbGez.

If possible, a copy of the criminal record. You can find this at: https://ujsportal.pacourts.us/.

Questions? Email ccch@comcast.net.

The workshop is open to the public. LASP serves Chester, Bucks, Delaware and Montgomery counties.

Flyer (1-page PDF) (download, print, share!)

View Event →

Unemployment Compensation Basics Workshop in Exton or virtual

EXTON - Learn from a LASP attorney at this hybrid workshop: "Understand the basics of Unemployment Compensation-What every employee should know BEFORE they apply." The free event is Monday, June 17, 2024 from 10-11 a.m.

In-person at PA CareerLink of Chester County, 479 Thomas Jones Way, Suite 500, Exton, PA 19380.

Virtual: Register with Keystone login at https://bit.ly/hybrid-uc-6-17-2024

or email Edwina Johnson at ejohnson@uwchestercounty.org to request a zoom link. (Please check spam folder if the link does not appear in your inbox.) Please register by Thursday, June 13.

Each clinic will be from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. at PA CareerLink, 479 Thomas Jones Way, Suite 500, Exton, PA 19380.

Legal Outreach in Pottstown

POTTSTOWN - The Salvation Army of Greater Pottstown will host Legal Aid of Southeastern PA for a free legal outreach in Pottstown on Wednesday, June 5, 2024 from 11:30 a.m.-1 p.m. The Salvation Army is located at 137 King St., Pottstown, PA 19464.

The clinic will provide free legal services for individuals with low incomes and those who are experiencing homelessness.

Have a question about the clinic? Contact Wendy at 610-326-1621.

Veterans Resource Fair in Springfield

SPRINGFIELD - The Delaware County Office of Military & Veteran Affairs is hosting a Veterans Resource Fair Tuesday, June 4, 2024 from 9 a.m.-12 p.m. at the Springfield YMCA, 194 W. Sproul Road, Springfield, PA 19064.

Stop by LASP's table at this event for information on VA benefits, discharge upgrades and other civil legal matters.

Flyer (1-page JPG)

Veterans Resource Fair in Malvern

MALVERN - The second annual Veterans Resource Fair will be Saturday, June 1, 2024 from 11 a.m.–2 p.m. at Greencastle, 400 Chesterfield Parkway, Malvern, PA 19355. This free event is for veterans and their families. It is presented by the Chester County Veterans Advisory Council & Chester County Dep. of Veterans Affairs.

Stop by Legal Aid of Southeastern PA’s table at this event for information on VA benefits, discharge upgrades and other civil legal matters.

The event will feature music, food, fun & veteran resources.

For more information visit: https://www.chesco.org/5353/Veterans-Resource-Fair

Flyer (1-page PDF)

View Event →

LASP Open House in Norristown ~ Celebrate local legal aid (Rain or shine)

NORRISTOWN - You're invited! Join us for an Open House on Wednesday, May 29, 2024 from 3-6 p.m. at 522/524 Swede Street, Norristown, PA 19401.

Free! Please RSVP to help us with planning. bit.ly/Open-House-5-29-2024

Brief remarks from:

Congresswoman Mary Gay Scanlon, Co-Chair of the Congressional Access to Legal Aid Caucus

Legal Outreach in Lansdale

LANSDALE - Legal Aid of Southeastern PA (LASP) will hold a free monthly outreach at Manna on Main Street / North Penn Commons, 606 E. Main St., Lansdale, PA 19446. Stop by our table on Thursday, April 25, May 23 & June 27, 2024 from 11 a.m.-1 p.m.

Have a question about the outreach? Contact Erika Felpel at 484-275-0672 or efelpel@lasp.org.

Se habla español. Language access & interpretation available for 240+ other languages.

Flyer (download, print, share!)

Some of the case types LASP handles: Bankruptcy, consumer law & debt relief, child custody & dependency, domestic violence / Protection from Abuse orders (PFAs), elder law, expungement, record-sealing and pardons, family law, housing (landlord-tenant, eviction, habitability, public & subsidized housing, rent-to-own), and home ownership (mortgage foreclosure, property tax sales, reverse mortgages, tangled title), Hurricane Ida / disaster legal aid, public benefits [Unemployment Compensation, SSI, SSDI, TANF (cash assistance), SNAP (food stamps), Medical Assistance (Medicaid) & more], utility problems, Veterans benefits & discharge upgrades.

Mobile Home Tax Reassessment Clinic in Phoenixville

PHOENIXVILLE - Join Legal Aid of Southeastern PA and United Way of Chester County for a Mobile Home Tax Reassessment outreach event! Get your mobile home taxes reassessed for free on Wednesday, May 22, 2024 from 5-7 p.m. at Phoenixville Area Senior Center, 153 Church St., Phoenixville, PA 19460.

What to bring:

Know the year, make, model and size of your mobile home

A property tax bill, preferably the school tax bill

Title or sales agreement to your mobile home (information about how much you paid for the home, including a bill of sale if you purchased within the past 5 years)

Insurance information

Assessment help is available in English and Spanish.

Since 2019, this impactful project has helped 1,014 mobile home owners save $800 annually!

Contacts:

For more information, visit https://bit.ly/unitedwaycc-mobile-homes or call 877-429-5994.

Para más información en español, llame a 610-436-4510.

Webpages:

https://bit.ly/unitedwaycc-mobile-homes

https://bit.ly/lasp-chesco-mobile-homes

Virtual Clean Slate and Expungement Workshop

Legal Aid of Southeastern PA will present a free, virtual Clean Slate and Expungement Workshop in partnership with the Coatesville Center for Community Health.

Register: https://bit.ly/3U7tJIt

Choose from the following dates:

Thursday, May 16, 2024 from 2:30-3:30 p.m. - VIRTUAL

Tuesday, June 18 from 3:30-4:30 p.m. - VIRTUAL (registration link to be provided later)

Clean Slate 3.0 is in effect! The new law expands eligibility & shortens some wait times for record-sealing! The workshop will help individuals with criminal histories who may have been denied employment or other services because of their criminal record.

Learn if you are eligible to have your criminal record sealed or expunged

Legal Aid of Southeastern Pennsylvania attorneys will help screen your PA record for FREE.

Help will be available to complete the necessary forms for those that are eligible.

Register in advance to attend

https://bit.ly/3U7tJIt

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

Bring with you

Intake Form to be completed in advance can be accessed here: https://pdf.ac/GbGez.

If possible, a copy of the criminal record. You can find this at: https://ujsportal.pacourts.us/.

Questions? Email ccch@comcast.net.

The workshop is open to the public. LASP serves Chester, Bucks, Delaware and Montgomery counties.

Senior Legal Clinic in Narberth

NARBERTH - Join Rep. Mary Jo Daley and LASP for a Senior Legal Clinic. The clinic will be Thursday, May 16 from 10 a.m.-2 p.m. at Narberth Municipal Center, 100 Conway Avenue, Narberth, PA 19072.

Get free help with simple wills, durable Powers of Attorney and healthcare directives at no cost for seniors (60+) who meet LASP’s income guidelines.

Registration is required. To ask a question or sign up, contact Erika Felpel at efelpel@lasp.org or 484-275-0672.

Expungement Clinic in Aldan

ALDAN - State Rep. Heather Boyd and Legal Aid of Southeastern PA (LASP) will hold an Expungement Clinic on Tuesday, May 14, 2024 from 5:30-7:30 p.m. at McBlain Community Center, 210 Shisler Ave., Aldan, PA 19018.

Register via Rep. Boyd’s office: 484-200-1563.

Only PA arrests are eligible.

Many misdemeanor convictions may be sealed if seven years have passed.

Must have no current criminal charges.

Must not be currently serving probation.

Some low-level drug & property-related felony convictions may be sealed if 10 years have passed.
